vulnerability_location.description: External call to msg.sender.call.value(_am)() is made before updating balances[msg.sender], allowing a reentrant call to drain funds.

Line 29: balances[msg.sender] += msg.value may overflow without bounds checking. Line 43: balances[msg.sender] -= _am can underflow after a reentrant call (wrong ordering of external call and state update).

External calls to TransferLog.AddMessage (lines 30 and 44) can revert and block execution of Deposit and CashOut, and the low-level call to msg.sender.call.value(_am)() (line 41) can fail causing funds to be stuck, resulting in denial of service.
Floating pragma version ^0.4.19 allows compilation with different compiler patch versions, leading to inconsistent behavior
